definition: perspicacious person/sb with a discerning eye/sighted person (as opposed to blind)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: A person with a discerning eye looks devalue, this statement points to continuously long swim.

sentences.english: Shen heart rarely talk about the housework, but everybody could see that she had not equal to idea.

sentences.english: As for those Saints in troubles, everyone with common sense can tell those are shams.

sentences.english: Anyone with a discerning eye can easily see (that ...).
A valuable lesson may be gleaned from it by those who have eyes to see.
sentences.chinese: 明眼人可從中記取寶貴的教訓。

sentences.english: The quality and intelligence, discerning look at all your jokes.
sentences.chinese: 明眼人都在看你們的笑話。
